info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued April 06 at 5:29PM EDT until April 06 at 6:00PM EDT by NWS Columbia
info.description: The National Weather Service in Columbia has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... North central Columbia County in east central Georgia... Southeastern Lincoln County in east central Georgia... West central Edgefield County in central South Carolina... Southeastern McCormick County in central South Carolina... * Until 600 PM EDT. * At 529 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Mistletoe State Park, or 15 miles northwest of Evans, moving north at 40 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to trees and powerlines. * Locations impacted include... McCormick, Mccormick County Airport, Hamilton Branch State Park, Clarks Hill Recreation Area, Parksville, Plum Branch, Lick Fork Campground, Leah, Modoc, Scott`s Landing, Knox Scout Reservation, Modoc Campground, Double Branches, Wildwood Park, Modoc Boat Ramp, Colliers, Lake Springs Recreation Area, Whitetown, Bussey Point Campground and Cherokee Boat Ramp. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM EDT for east central Georgia...and central South Carolina.
